revised_title: Intergranular Precipitates and Creep Cavitation: A Model for Cavitational Failure
tldr: The author presents a model for cavitational failure in creep that accounts for the role of intergranular precipitates in controlling creep cavitation. The model is based on the transfer of vacancies from high-angle grain boundaries to intergranular precipitates, satisfying the low stress requirement for cavity growth. This mechanism is relevant for materials with a high fraction of the applied load converted into surface energy.
